pageContent.title: <Introtext style="font-family:Helvetica; font-size:14pt; font-weight:bold; color:#cc0033; margin:10px -5px 10px 5px; padding:5px 0 5px 5px; background:#e8e8e8; border-bottom:1px solid #333; display:block;">Using Trends in a Customer Conversation</Introtext>
pageContent.instructions: <welcomeText style=" font-family:Helvetica; font-size:11pt; line-height:18pt; text-align:justify; font-weight:bold; color:#333; display:block; margin:0 10px 10px">What is the best way to use trends in a conversation with Dr. Bennett?</welcomeText>

choice.choiceText: A. Ask Dr. Bennett what Sunnydale Psychiatry’s patient volume looks likes for the coming month to get a feel for how healthcare reform may be affecting their practice.

B. Tell Dr. Bennett that you have scheduled a speaker program. Ask Dr. Bennett what he thinks the top trends are that affect his desired outcomes, and also find out as a prescriber of your product, what he believes he needs the most education on.
C. Ask Dr. Bennett what trends he believes are currently impacting Sunnydale Psychiatry. Arrange for an office lunch to discuss his feedback.
D. Find out from Dr. Bennett how he has been using your product lately. Detail your product and leave starters.

pageContent.summary: <welcomeText style=" font-family:Helvetica; font-size:12pt; line-height:18pt; text-align:justify; font-weight:normal; color:#333; display:block; margin:0 10px 10px">This is a great opportunity to involve Dr. Bennett and learn about the most important trend affecting his practice outcomes (Choice B). Choice A assumes that healthcare reform is the most important trend for Sunnydale Psychiatry, and you miss an opportunity to discuss trends with Dr. Bennett in a way that positions you as a trusted advisor. If you chose C, you didn’t include his desired outcomes in the conversation and how your solutions can add value. Again, with Choice D, you made an assumption about what trend was most important for Dr. Bennett’s business, and missed an opportunity to build trust as an advisor to Dr. Bennett. Choice B is the best choice.</welcomeText>
